guild.description: ruqqus.com changelog
guild.description_html: ruqqus.com changelog
guild.name: changelog

post.body:
About 95% of this patch was written by you guys. If you're included here and don't already have Codesmith title, give me your Ruqqus name from the github PR page and I will grant it to you.

- Added "Ruqqus" to page metadata more promenently by @crystalvulpine
- Move the Linux documentation written by @rostredd, also by @crystalvulpine
- Improved JSON data for submissions by mpieciak18
- Favicon fixes by @kaijuagenda
- Changed the kick icon, also by @crystalvulpine
- Fixed a typo in the slur list by wp140x
- Fixed a seed data typo by @Foxite
- Date/time improvements, also by @foxite

Also changed some interactions with temporarily banned users and guildmaster actions. Temp-banned users can now continue to moderate their guilds for the duration of their temporary ban, and do not automatically count as inactive for the purposes of guild siege.
post.body_html:
About 95% of this patch was written by you guys. If you're included here and don't already have Codesmith title, give me your Ruqqus name from the github PR page and I will grant it to you.

  • Added "Ruqqus" to page metadata more promenently by @CrystalVulpine
  • Move the Linux documentation written by @Rostredd, also by @CrystalVulpine
  • Improved JSON data for submissions by mpieciak18
  • Favicon fixes by @KaijuAgenda
  • Changed the kick icon, also by @CrystalVulpine
  • Fixed a typo in the slur list by wp140x
  • Fixed a seed data typo by @foxite
  • Date/time improvements, also by @foxite

Also changed some interactions with temporarily banned users and guildmaster actions. Temp-banned users can now continue to moderate their guilds for the duration of their temporary ban, and do not automatically count as inactive for the purposes of guild siege.
post.title: Ruqqus 2.17.7 - The User-Powered Patch

body:
That's a server error. It appears to be fixed now.

There is no limit on how many guilds you can join. There is, however, a limit of 10 guilds you can be a guildmaster of.
body_html:
That's a server error. It appears to be fixed now.

There is no limit on how many guilds you can join. There is, however, a limit of 10 guilds you can be a guildmaster of.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

post.body:
Title explains most of it. I have currently joined 8 guilds, but for some reason I can't join any more. Whenever I press the join button it shows a Red panel with an exclamation point on it. This happened on both mobile browser (IOS) and desktop. Is this supposed to happen?
Edit: Has been resolved. Thank you Ruqqus staff

Whenever I press the join button it shows a Red panel with an exclamation point on it. This happened on both mobile browser (IOS) and desktop. Is this supposed to happen? Edit: Has been resolved. Thank you Ruqqus staff

parent.body: Simple solution is to start adding more niche subs. I know I’m being a hypocrite, but we need to start making more subs centered around very particular interests. I think humor/meme subreddits would probably yield the best results. The thing with other niches though is that we don’t know if they’ll gain traction or not.
parent.body_html: Simple solution is to start adding more niche subs. I know I’m being a hypocrite, but we need to start making more subs centered around very particular interests. I think humor/meme subreddits would probably yield the best results. The thing with other niches though is that we don’t know if they’ll gain traction or not.

body:
It was actually made on Linux, but unfortunately there's no executable download yet, you'll have to compile it from source yourself if you want to use it: https://github.com/CrystalVulpine/VoxelPlanet

Be warned though, its functionality is still extremely low right now.

It was actually made on Linux, but unfortunately there's no executable download yet, you'll have to compile it from source yourself if you want to use it: https://github.com/CrystalVulpine/VoxelPlanet

Be warned though, its functionality is still extremely low right now.

body: Also, don't expect a lot of fast development on this, because 1) OpenGL sucks, and 2) I'm lazy and can't focus on boring stuff for long periods of time. Once it gets off the ground and I actually have more interesting stuff to do it'll move faster. For now, if anyone wants to help me ray select cube faces from the center pixel of the screen that'd be fantastic.
body_html: Also, don't expect a lot of fast development on this, because 1) OpenGL sucks, and 2) I'm lazy and can't focus on boring stuff for long periods of time. Once it gets off the ground and I actually have more interesting stuff to do it'll move faster. For now, if anyone wants to help me ray select cube faces from the center pixel of the screen that'd be fantastic.

It's just a github right now, no releases yet unfortunately. If you actually care that much to check it out you'll have to build it from source. There's a good reason for this, because right now it barely even works.

Note: This has nothing to do with the other Voxel Planet made about 5 years ago that actually made a spherical planet out of voxels.

body:
So, it looks like you answered a libertarian opinion for every single question. Not the most extreme one every time, but you're definitely very libertarian-minded. Your ideology seems to be as little government and restrictions as you believe can still be sustainable. Sounds pretty minarchist to me.

Don't be shocked with how close you are to ancap. The primary disagreement between minarchists and ancaps is about whether it's possible to completely abolish the state without everything breaking down, and that's pretty much it. The underlying philosophy is the same, allowing as much individual freedom as possible. That's why the test placed you so deep into the libertarian section, and it makes sense; I'd say it's working as intended in this case.
body_html:
So, it looks like you answered a libertarian opinion for every single question. Not the most extreme one every time, but you're definitely very libertarian-minded. Your ideology seems to be as little government and restrictions as you believe can still be sustainable. Sounds pretty minarchist to me.

Don't be shocked with how close you are to ancap. The primary disagreement between minarchists and ancaps is about whether it's possible to completely abolish the state without everything breaking down, and that's pretty much it. The underlying philosophy is the same, allowing as much individual freedom as possible. That's why the test placed you so deep into the libertarian section, and it makes sense; I'd say it's working as intended in this case.

parent.body:
If number of questions remains short you could have an index for the answers and add entries to the query string for each.

You could also do what I see a lot of people doing and abuse local storage.  It makes things a nightmare to debug sometimes, though.

Yeah, minarchist is closer, I was more shocked at the visual of how close to ancap it placed me.  Maybe I really am that extreme and didn't realise it until now.  The traditional compass always placed me pretty close to center, leaning lib right, more lib than right I believe.

parent.body:
I love what you're doing, but it may need some work.  With where it put me, I'm a super ancap.  In the real world, I know that ancap is a fantasy, much like the communist utopia.  I don't feel like I picked all of the ancap positions in the quiz, but I'll be honest I have no idea how to improve it to get what (I think?) Is a more accurate position in the chart for me.

https://crystalvulpine.github.io/PoliticalTriangle/results.html?left=0&right=0&lib=8.33

If you want I can detail the answers I gave, don't know if you have some way to see them from the above (I doubt you can based solely on the url and args).  While developing this it may be beneficial to give each selection a number so you can get faster/easier feedback into how people answered to get their result?  Just a suggestion.

Keep up the good work, friend.  I wish I had the motivation to follow through on any of my personal project ideas.  I love where this is going, and I want to keep an eye on your progress.

Edit: maybe just putting the questions and your selected answers on the results page would be a better way to get that feedback?

parent.body:
thats actually right, if we could have a piramid with 3 axes, progressive, economic and freedom we would be able to understand better about pol, it would be a 3D example of things like:

>economy

more economy = market freedom
less economy = less freedom

>progressive

less culture = less progressivism
more culture = more progressism

>freedom


less freedom = less individual freedoms
more freedom = more individual freedoms

this alone would help us understand the vast majority of ideologies without the need to keep the label "left"and "right" because we would be able to properly place everything in their position
parent.body_html:

economy

post.title: How yall are actually using the compass

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
It's a solid idea, but it's flawed because it still only represents 2 sides of the debate, just with a split between economic and social. Libright on the compass is more neoliberal than libertarian. And it can't seem to distinguish crony capitalism from free markets.

I think the triangle that compares the 3 different philosophies underlying most political beliefs is better: left (legislated equality), right (legislated hierarchy), and libertarian (less legislation, individualism). I actually made a quiz for that here: https://crystalvulpine.github.io/PoliticalTriangle

It's still very early in development and in the making, so if you decide to take it let me know what you think.

---

This might actually also solve the argument about the existence of the libleft quadrant. I'd expect most libertarian-minded people to look at the auth/lib axis as more or less government involvement in people's lives, whereas others may see it as most test websites do as a conservative vs progressive thing. Under the former perspective, libleft indeed makes no sense: you can't have socialism without involvement from some kind of authority. However, with the latter way of looking at it, the government can still hold power, so libleft in that case is possible.
body_html:
It's a solid idea, but it's flawed because it still only represents 2 sides of the debate, just with a split between economic and social. Libright on the compass is more neoliberal than libertarian. And it can't seem to distinguish crony capitalism from free markets.

I think the triangle that compares the 3 different philosophies underlying most political beliefs is better: left (legislated equality), right (legislated hierarchy), and libertarian (less legislation, individualism). I actually made a quiz for that here: https://crystalvulpine.github.io/PoliticalTriangle

It's still very early in development and in the making, so if you decide to take it let me know what you think.

This might actually also solve the argument about the existence of the libleft quadrant. I'd expect most libertarian-minded people to look at the auth/lib axis as more or less government involvement in people's lives, whereas others may see it as most test websites do as a conservative vs progressive thing. Under the former perspective, libleft indeed makes no sense: you can't have socialism without involvement from some kind of authority. However, with the latter way of looking at it, the government can still hold power, so libleft in that case is possible.

body: It's likely because it's hard to send a notification to someone's inbox from a post, but for a comment it's easy. Reddit actually never had pings for posts.
body_html: It's likely because it's hard to send a notification to someone's inbox from a post, but for a comment it's easy. Reddit actually never had pings for posts.
